company_name.value: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Company Limited

product_uin.description: Unique Identification Number of the product

product_type.description: Type of the insurance product (e.g., Term, ULIP, Endowment)

distribution_channel.description: Distribution channel for the product (e.g., Online, Offline, Online and Offline, Agent)

plan_description.value:
1. **Coverage against female organ cancers**: Includes breast cancer and cervical cancer under **Accelerated Critical Illness Benefit**.
2. **Special premium rates**: Offers special premium rates for **Accelerated Critical Illness Benefit**.
3. **Discount on premium rates**: Provides a **15% discount** on premium rates for life cover (Death Benefit) compared to male lives.
4. **Enhanced protection**: Coverage against **death**, **terminal illness**, and **disability**.
5. **Comprehensive additional benefits**: Option to choose **Accidental Death Benefit** and **Accelerated Critical Illness Benefit**.
6. **Special premium rates for non-tobacco users**: Offers lower premiums for non-tobacco users.
7. **Discount on first year’s premium**: Available for **salaried customers**.
8. **Need-based benefit payout**: Choose to receive the benefit amount as a **lump sum** or as **monthly income** for 10/20/30 years or a combination of both.
9. **Flexibility in premium payments**: Options to pay premiums **once**, for a **limited period**, or throughout the **policy term**.
10. **Tax benefits**: May be applicable on premiums paid and benefits received as per the prevailing tax laws.
plan_description.description: Key features and benefits of the ICICI Policy
chunks:
Covers female organ cancers such as breast cancer and cervical cancer under Accelerated Critical Illness Beneﬁt
Special premium rates for Accelerated Critical Illness Beneﬁt 
15% discount on premium rates for life cover (Death Beneﬁt) as compared to male lives
Key beneﬁts for women
Enhanced protection: Coverage against death, terminal illness and disability
Comprehensive additional beneﬁts: Option to choose Accidental Death Beneﬁt and Accelerated 
Critical Illness Beneﬁt
Special premium rates for non-tobacco users
Special discount on ﬁrst year’s premium for salaried customers
Need based beneﬁt payout: Choose to receive the beneﬁt amount as a lump sum or as monthly 
income for 10/ 20/ 30 years or a combination of both
Flexibility to pay premiums once, for a limited period or throughout the policy term
Tax Beneﬁts may be applicable on premiums paid and beneﬁts received as per the prevailing tax laws 
Key features

plan_options.value:
1. **Life**: Death Benefit + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability  
2. **Life Plus**: Death Benefit + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability + Accidental Death Benefit  
3. **Life & Health**: Death Benefit + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability + Accelerated Critical Illness Benefit  
4. **All in One**: Death Benefit + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability + Accidental Death Benefit + Accelerated Critical Illness Benefit
plan_options.description: Available plan options for the ICICI Policy
chunks:
How does this plan protect you
You can choose your level of protection by selecting one of the below beneﬁt options:
Beneﬁt Option     Beneﬁts
Life Death Beneﬁt + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability 
Life Plus  Death Beneﬁt + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability 
 + Accidental Death Beneﬁt
Life & Health Death Beneﬁt + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability 
 + Accelerated Critical Illness Beneﬁt
All in One Death Beneﬁt + Terminal Illness + Waiver of Premium on permanent disability
 + Accidental Death Beneﬁt + Accelerated Critical Illness Beneﬁt
Your premium will vary depending on the beneﬁt option chosen.
How does this plan protect you
Above premiums are applicable for a healthy non-smoker non-salaried male life with annual mode of payment and premiums paid 
regularly for the policy term of 20 years with lumpsum payout option with Life Cover: 1 Crore, Accidental Death Beneﬁt: 1 Crore,

other_benefits.value:
1. **Marriage**: Additional Sum Assured of **50%** of the original Sum Assured, with a maximum additional Sum Assured of ₹50,00,000.
2. **Birth / Legal adoption of 1st child**: Additional Sum Assured of **25%** of the original Sum Assured, with a maximum additional Sum Assured of ₹25,00,000.
3. **Birth / Legal adoption of 2nd child**: Additional Sum Assured of **25%** of the original Sum Assured, with a maximum additional Sum Assured of ₹25,00,000.
other_benefits.description: Additional benefits included in the ICICI Policy related to life events such as marriage and child adoption.
chunks:
policy, ICICI Pru iProtect Smart offers the ﬂexibility to increase the level of protection of Life Assured at key life stages of 
marriage and child birth/ adoption of child, without any medicals as below.
Additional premium will be calculated based on the increased Sum Assured and outstanding policy term as per your 
age at the time of each such increase. 
                     Event Additional Sum Assured Maximum additional 
   (percentage of original Sum Assured) Sum Assured
                    Marriage 50% ` 50,00,000
Birth / Legal adoption of 1st child 25% ` 25,00,000

death_benefit_payment_option.value:
1. **Death Benefit Payout Options**:
   - The total amount payable on death or terminal illness is equal to the **Death Benefit** reduced by any **ACI benefit** paid.
   - The **Death Benefit** can be paid as a combination of **income** and **lump sum** payout options.
   - The percentage of the **Death Benefit** to be paid out as **lump sum** is chosen at inception.
   - The balance **Death Benefit** will be paid out in equal monthly installments in advance for the chosen **Income Term**.

2. **Income Term Options**:
   - **10 years**: 10% of the **Death Benefit** payable per annum in the first year, increasing by 10% per annum thereafter.
   - **20 years**: 5% of the **Death Benefit** payable per annum.
   - **30 years**: 3.33% of the **Death Benefit** payable per annum.

3. **Monthly Payment Rates**:
   - For **10 years**: 0.83333% of the **Death Benefit** payable monthly if the first year benefit is taken as lump sum.
   - For **20 years**: 0.41667% of the **Death Benefit** payable monthly.
   - For **30 years**: 0.27778% of the **Death Benefit** payable monthly.

4. **Lump Sum and Income**:
   - The first year’s income can be advanced as a lump sum, with subsequent monthly income starting from the following month for the remaining income term at a defined rate of the **Death Benefit** amount.

beneﬁt amount per annum in the ﬁrst year. The income amount will increase by 10% per annum simple interest 
every year thereafter. Sum of total monthly beneﬁts payable over 10 years is equal to 145% of the death beneﬁt

death_benefits.value:
1. **Death Benefit** is payable to the nominee/legal heir on the first occurrence of either:
   - **Death of the Life Assured**
   - **Diagnosis of Terminal Illness**

2. The policy will terminate upon payment of the Death Benefit.

3. **Death Benefit** options include:
   - **Single Pay**: Higher of:
     - 125% of the Single Premium
     - **Sum Assured** chosen by you
   - **Regular Pay and Limited Pay**: Higher of:
     - 7 times the annualized premium
     - 105% of the total premiums received up to the date of death or diagnosis of terminal illness
     - **Sum Assured** chosen by you

4. **Minimum Sum Assured**: ₹1,00,000

5. **Maximum Sum Assured**: Unlimited

6. Additional coverage includes **Accidental Death Benefit**, which pays a lump sum in case of death due to an accident within the Accidental Death Benefit term.

instant_cash_benefit.value: The **Accelerated Critical Illness Benefit (ACI Benefit)** provides an instant cash benefit of a lump sum payment upon the first occurrence of any of the covered 34 critical illnesses. This benefit is payable irrespective of the actual expenses incurred by the policyholder. However, it is important to note that the ACI Benefit is **accelerated**, meaning that the **Death Benefit** of the policy will be reduced by the amount of the ACI Benefit paid. Additionally, premium payments related to the ACI Benefit will cease after the payout.
instant_cash_benefit.description: Details regarding the instant cash benefits available under the ICICI Policy, specifically the ACI Benefit.
chunks:
In this option, along with the beneﬁts under the Life Option, you are also covered for the Accelerated Critical Illness 
Beneﬁt (ACI Beneﬁt). The ACI Beneﬁt offers you coverage against 34 critical illnesses. When a major illness strikes, it 
can place a huge burden on your family, not only because of the cost of medical care but also because you may not be 
able to work. To protect you against this, we will pay you the ACI Beneﬁt, as a lump sum to meet your ﬁnancial needs. 
The beneﬁt is payable irrespective of the actual expenses incurred by the policyholder.
This beneﬁt is payable, on ﬁrst occurrence of any of the covered 34 illnesses. The ACI Beneﬁt, is accelerated and not an 
additional beneﬁt which means, the policy will continue with the Death Beneﬁt reduced by the extent of the ACI Beneﬁt 
paid. Premium payment on account of ACI Beneﬁt will cease after payout of ACI Beneﬁt and the future premiums

surrender_benefits.value:
1. **Surrender Value**: For Single Pay policies, the surrender value is equal to the **Unexpired Risk Premium Value** if the policyholder voluntarily surrenders the policy during the policy term.

2. **Unexpired Risk Premium Value Calculation**: 
   - For Single Pay policies: 
     - Unexpired Risk Premium Value = 25% X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X **Total Premiums Paid**.
   - For Limited Pay policies: 
     - If one full year’s premium is not paid, Unexpired Risk Premium Value = 0.
     - If one full year’s premium has been paid, then Unexpired Risk Premium Value = 25% X [Number of months for which premiums are paid / (Premium Payment Term X 12)] X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X **Total Premiums Paid**.
   - For Regular Pay policies: 
     - Unexpired Risk Premium Value = 0 if any premium installment is not paid within the grace period.

3. **Policy Termination**: Once the surrender feature is exercised and the benefit is paid, the policy shall terminate, and all benefits and interests under this policy will stand extinguished.

4. **Total Premiums Paid**: This refers to the total of all premiums paid under the base product, excluding any extra premium and taxes, if collected.

5. **Grace Period**: If the premium is not paid either on the premium due date or within the grace period, all benefits under this policy will cease.
surrender_benefits.description: Surrender benefits for the ICICI Policy, excluding paid-up value and exit options.
chunks:
Maturity or paid-up or survival beneﬁt
Surrender
For Single Pay policies, Surrender value equal to unexpired risk premium value will be payable if the policy holder voluntarily 
surrenders the policy during the policy term.
Unexpired risk premium value = 25% X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X Total Premiums Paid.
For unexpired risk premium value for Limited Pay policies & Regular policies, please refer T&C 13.
Once this feature is exercised and the beneﬁt is paid, the policy shall terminate and all beneﬁts and interests under this policy 
will stand extinguished. The policyholder can either opt for Smart Exit Beneﬁt or Unexpired Risk Premium Value as per S. No. 
13 of Terms & Conditions below i.e. he cannot avail both the beneﬁts simultaneously.
**Total Premiums Paid means the total of all premiums paid under the base product, excluding any extra premium, and taxes, if collected

This is subject to change from time to time.
Refer https://www.iciciprulife.com/services/grievance-redressal.html for 
more details

grace period, all beneﬁts under this policy will cease.

surrender_value_factor.value:
On policy surrender, **Surrender Value** equal to **Unexpired risk premium value** will be payable: 
1. **Limited Pay**: 
   - If one full year’s premium is not paid, **Unexpired risk premium value** = 0. 
   - If one full year’s premium has been paid, then the **Unexpired risk premium value** = 25% X [Number of months for which premiums are paid / (Premium Payment Term X 12)] X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X Total Premiums Paid. 
2. **Regular Pay**: 
   - **Unexpired risk premium value** = 0.

exit_options.value:
1. **Smart Exit Benefit**: This option allows the policyholder to cancel the policy and receive a benefit equal to **Total Premiums Paid** under the policy. No additional premium is payable to avail this option.

2. **Eligibility for Smart Exit Benefit**: 
   - The option can be exercised in any policy year greater than 25 but not during the last 5 policy years.
   - The age of the life assured must be 60 years or more at the time of exercise.
   - The policy must be in-force with all due premiums paid at the time of exercising this option.

3. **Total Premiums Paid**: This refers to the total of all premiums paid under the base product, excluding any extra premium and taxes, if collected.

4. **Exclusion of Other Benefits**: The policyholder can either opt for **Smart Exit Benefit** or **Unexpired Risk Premium Value** but cannot avail both benefits simultaneously.
exit_options.description: Exit values/options/benefits available for the policy excluding surrender benefits and paid-up value.
chunks:
explicitly. Where Life Stage Protection options has been exercised, Total Premiums Paid includes Premium paid for each tranche of additional 
sum assured purchased. In case the beneﬁt term for additional beneﬁt(s), for which additional premium has been paid, has expired at the time 
of exercise of Smart Exit Beneﬁt, then Total Premiums Paid shall exclude the premium paid towards such additional beneﬁt(s).
You have an option to cancel the policy and receive Smart Exit Beneﬁt, equal to Total Premiums Paid** under the policy. No 
additional premium is payable to avail this option. 
The following terms and conditions shall apply:
•  This option can be exercised in any policy year greater than 25 but not during the last 5 policy years, provided the age of  
 the life assured is 60 years or more at the time of exercise.
•  The policy is in-force with all due premiums paid at the time of exercising this option.

Maturity or paid-up or survival beneﬁt
Surrender
For Single Pay policies, Surrender value equal to unexpired risk premium value will be payable if the policy holder voluntarily 
surrenders the policy during the policy term.
Unexpired risk premium value = 25% X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X Total Premiums Paid.
For unexpired risk premium value for Limited Pay policies & Regular policies, please refer T&C 13.
Once this feature is exercised and the beneﬁt is paid, the policy shall terminate and all beneﬁts and interests under this policy 
will stand extinguished. The policyholder can either opt for Smart Exit Beneﬁt or Unexpired Risk Premium Value as per S. No. 
13 of Terms & Conditions below i.e. he cannot avail both the beneﬁts simultaneously.
**Total Premiums Paid means the total of all premiums paid under the base product, excluding any extra premium, and taxes, if collected

exit_option_conditions.value:
1. **Smart Exit Benefit**: The policyholder has the option to cancel the policy and receive a Smart Exit Benefit equal to **Total Premiums Paid** under the policy. No additional premium is payable to avail this option.

2. **Conditions for Exercising Smart Exit Benefit**:
   - This option can be exercised in any policy year greater than **25** but not during the last **5** policy years.
   - The age of the life assured must be **60 years or more** at the time of exercise.
   - The policy must be in-force with all due premiums paid at the time of exercising this option.

3. **Surrender Value for Single Pay Policies**: If the policyholder voluntarily surrenders the policy during the policy term, the surrender value will be equal to the **unexpired risk premium value**.
   - **Unexpired Risk Premium Value** is calculated as: **25% X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X Total Premiums Paid**.

4. **Termination of Policy**: Once the Smart Exit Benefit is exercised and the benefit is paid, the policy shall terminate, and all benefits and interests under this policy will stand extinguished.

5. **Choice of Benefits**: The policyholder can either opt for **Smart Exit Benefit** or **Unexpired Risk Premium Value** as per the terms and conditions, but cannot avail both benefits simultaneously.
exit_option_conditions.description: Exit value/options/benefits terms/conditions for the ICICI Policy
chunks:

Unexpired risk premium value = 25% X [1 – (Policy Month of surrender – 1)/ (Policy Term X 12)] X Total Premiums Paid.

13 of Terms & Conditions below i.e. he cannot avail both the beneﬁts simultaneously.
**Total Premiums Paid means the total of all premiums paid under the base product, excluding any extra premium, and taxes, if collected

discount_high_sum.value: A discount is offered on the first year’s premium of **Death Benefit**, **Terminal Illness**, and **Waiver of Premium on permanent disability** for customers opting for a **sum assured greater than or equal to ₹10,000,000**.
discount_high_sum.description: Details regarding high sum assured discount available in the ICICI Policy.
chunks:
•  The policy is in-force with all due premiums paid at the time of exercising this option.
•  No claim for any of the underlying beneﬁts has been registered and is under evaluation/ or accepted/ or paid/ being paid 
 on the policy. 
A discount as mentioned below will be offered on ﬁrst year’s premium of Death Beneﬁt, Terminal Illness and Waiver of 
Premium on permanent disability (excluding rider premiums, underwriting extra premiums and taxes) to salaried customers 
opting for sum assured greater than or equal to `10,000,000:
There is no maturity, paid-up value or survival beneﬁt available under this product.

conditions of the policy or otherwise and have not made any claim, you 
may return the policy document to the Company with reasons for 
cancellation within 30 days from the date of receipt of the policy 
document.
